coredata.dc:title: FuCoLoT – A Fully-Correlational Long-Term Tracker
coredata.prism:publicationName: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)

abstract.ce:para: We propose FuCoLoT – a Fully Correlational Long-term Tracker. It exploits the novel DCF constrained filter learning method to design a detector that is able to re-detect the target in the whole image efficiently. FuCoLoT maintains several correlation filters trained on different time scales that act as the detector components. A novel mechanism based on the correlation response is used for tracking failure estimation. FuCoLoT achieves state-of-the-art results on standard short-term benchmarks and it outperforms the current best-performing tracker on the long-term UAV20L benchmark by over 19%. It has an order of magnitude smaller memory footprint than its best-performing competitors and runs at 15Â fps in a single CPU thread.

affiliation.affilname: Ceské vysoké ucení technické v Praze

xocs:funding.xocs:funding-agency-matched-string: The Czech Science Foundation Project GACR P103/12/G084

xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Acknowledgement. This work was partly supported by the following research programs and projects: Slovenian research agency research programs and projects P2-0214 and J2-8175. Jiˇrí Matas and Tomáˇs Vojíˇr were supported by The Czech Science Foundation Project GACR P103/12/G084 and Toyota Motor Europe.

abstract.ce:para: We propose FuCoLoT – a Fully Correlational Long-term Tracker. It exploits the novel DCF constrained filter learning method to design a detector that is able to re-detect the target in the whole image efficiently. FuCoLoT maintains several correlation filters trained on different time scales that act as the detector components. A novel mechanism based on the correlation response is used for tracking failure estimation. FuCoLoT achieves state-of-the-art results on standard short-term benchmarks and it outperforms the current best-performing tracker on the long-term UAV20L benchmark by over 19%. It has an order of magnitude smaller memory footprint than its best-performing competitors and runs at 15Â fps in a single CPU thread.
